title: Miss Fortune bug
body: In practice tool as Miss Fortune level 6, with unlimited cooldown, and you use her ultimate and step out quickly then activate it again within 3 seconds, there are two ults that do damage. You can have up to three if you do it really quickly.{{champion:21}}

replies.body:
Ehhhhhh if you have unlimited cooldowns turned on then that ultimate won't have any cooldown time, which means you're able to rapid fire it as quickly as you can click. This would happen with any champion. 

If I'm missing something here about your description, grab a video if you can so I can actually see what's going on.

Also while you're here. Can you tell me if rito is aware of the bug on teemo that when he casts his blind on gromp for the first time gromp does not get blinded? It's really annoying and I've reported it a few times going back like a year with no word.

You could try using the in-client bug report tool to see if that works out better.
If you can, add a video.
It's at the very bottom right of the client when you're logged in.
(it looks like a beetle).

Edit: I'll also go check if it's still there on Pbe right now.
If it is I'll report it there as well, linking back to this (your) post:
https://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/bug-report/Tr5bBx8E-jungle-teemo
thanks dude, also gj finding my original post haha.

NP.  Yeah, the bug is still there on Pbe so I did report it there using the bug tool.

Hope they fix it soon; seems annoying AF to deal with.

Normally when you move/attack/cast another spell it cancels miss fortunes ulti and it stops firing. So no matter how low the cool-down you can never have 2 or 3 ulti's going at once.

That is to say, you can cast your ultimate, then move canceling the channel, then when you recast your ultimate, two ultimate's will fire off at the same time.

http://puu.sh/xafJF/a577a7ea07.jpg
Oh SNAP I was misunderstanding! Yea that's probably not intended. I'd go ahead and post this, and the Teemo incident, over in Report a Bug to make sure the devs catch it!

You're first hunch was right Broporo <3

That's actually the "normal" interaction for channeled spells in practice mode with cd refresh on.
It's hella weird but I'm pretty sure they're ok with it due to it not affecting real gameplay.
